intro: Meibomia megaphylla, commonly known as the giant leaf meibomia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries as fruit. Meibomia megaphylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets.
